item.title: 7 Pnotions
item.description: I'm gonna install the iOS16 buggy beta on my phone and break its software, or maybe I will just sleep today ğŸ¥±
item.content:encoded:
I'm gonna install the iOS16 buggy beta on my phone and break its software, or maybe I will just sleep today ğŸ¥±

Hello everyone,

Welcome to Pnotions. It is a blog and a newsletter to share the interesting articles I read on technology and engineering. And more. It was tough to shortlist, but I did it.

Happy reading ğŸ‘¾

Technologyâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Apple WWDC 2022: the 16 biggest announcements

Highly-anticipated macOS Ventura, iOS 16, the M2 chip, a new MacBook Air, and much more.

ğŸ‘¾ Symbiote: A New, Nearly-Impossible-to-Detect Linux Threat

What makes Symbiote different from other Linux malware that we usually come across, is that it needs to infect other running processes to inflict damage on infected machines.

ğŸ‘¾ WWDC: Apple, Cloudflare, Fastly plot the end of CAPTCHA

Apple is working with Cloudflare and Fastly to replace annoying CAPTCHA sessions with seamless authorization to protect privacy.

ğŸ‘¾ MIT Researchers Discover New Flaw in Apple M1 CPUs That Can't Be Patched

The vulnerability is rooted in pointer authentication codes (PACs), a line of defense introduced in arm64e architecture that aims to detect and secure against unexpected changes to pointers.

ğŸ‘¾ Weâ€™re one step closer to Windows in the cloud

Microsoft is bound and determined to move your old Windows setup to Desktop-as-a-Service (DaaS).

ğŸ‘¾ Firefox and Chrome are squaring off over ad-blocker extensions

Mozilla will let extensions use the most privacy-preserving blocking techniques on network traffic.

Engineeringâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Helm Chart DB

Check if the helm chart you are using meets the industry best practices.

ğŸ‘¾ Load balancing gRPC in Kubernetes with Istio

Properly load balance your gRPC applications by leveraging open source service mesh solutions.

ğŸ‘¾ How to detect TOR network connections with Falco

How to detect inbound and outbound network connections through the TOR network using Falco.

ğŸ‘¾ A database for 2022

Hi, itâ€™s us again, the ones who used to store our database in a single JSON file on disk, and then moved to etcd. Time for another change! Weâ€™re going to put everything in a single file on disk again.

ğŸ‘¾ APIs Donâ€™t Have to be So Difficult

Overcome the limitations of APIs and build a better future.

ğŸ‘¾ ttl.sh

An anonymous & ephemeral Docker image registry.

Interesting readsâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ BatNoter

ğŸ‘¾ Calculating 100 trillion digits of pi on Google Cloud

ğŸ‘¾ dns.toys

ğŸ‘¾ Coinbase CEO Tweets â€˜Quit And Find A Company You Believe Inâ€™ To Disgruntled Employees

Crazy BLOG of the weekâ€‹

ğŸ¥¾ A trail tale

Andy Moliski and his brothers built this unique blog to give everyone the experience of reaching Katahdin (the trailâ€™s northern terminus), no matter where or when you are in life.

Funâ€‹

If you like my letters, go crazy ğŸ‘½

Prashanthi

Newsletter #7 Pnotions

item.title: 6 Pnotions
item.content:encoded:
Sup? ğŸ¦¹ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸

Hello everyone,

Welcome to Pnotions. It is a blog and a newsletter to share the interesting articles I read on technology and engineering. And more. It was tough to shortlist, but I did it.

Happy reading ğŸ‘¾

Technologyâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Distrobox

Use any Linux distribution inside your terminal. Enable both backward and forward compatibility with software and freedom to use whatever distribution youâ€™re more comfortable with. Distrobox uses podman or docker to create containers using the Linux distribution of your choice.

ğŸ‘¾ Datadog finds serverless computing is going mainstream

Datadog has found that serverless computing could be entering the mainstream with over half of all organizations using serverless on one of the three major clouds â€“ Amazon, Microsoft and Google.

ğŸ‘¾ The Murena One shows exactly how hard it is to de-Google your smartphone

An Android phone without Google. No Google apps, no Google Play Services, no peppy Google Assistant. No Google surveillance and data snooping, no incessant ad targeting, no feeling like privacy is a pointless exercise.

ğŸ‘¾ This book made me fall in love with electronics all over again

Book: Open Circuits - The Inner Beauty of Electronic Components by Windell Oskay and Eric Schlaepfer

ğŸ‘¾ Graviton 3: First Impressions

AWS Graviton 3 was the first ARM CPU to introduce the SVE instruction set to a widely accessible server CPU.

Engineeringâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ A Design Analysis of Cloud-based Microservices Architecture at Netflix

A comprehensive system design analysis of microservices architecture at Netflix to power its global video streaming services.

ğŸ‘¾ KubeCon EU 2022 â€“ Trends & Highlights

KubeCon EU 2022 hot takes.

ğŸ‘¾ Nginx proxy manager

Docker container for managing Nginx proxy hosts with a simple, powerful interface.

ğŸ‘¾ Bootstrapping clusters with EKS Blueprints

EKS Blueprints is a collection of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) modules that will help you configure and deploy consistent, EKS clusters across accounts and regions.

ğŸ‘¾ Proper use of Git tags

Tag specific points in a repositoryâ€™s history.

Interesting readsâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ JSON Visio - Visualize your JSON data onto graphs seamlessly

ğŸ‘¾ Coffee Drinking Linked to Lower Mortality Risk, New Study Finds

ğŸ‘¾ That time a techie accidentally improved an airline's productivity

ğŸ‘¾ Electrifying Ext4

Crazy FROG of the weekâ€‹

ğŸ¸ Stills of Kermit The Frog from DALLÂ·E

Funâ€‹

If you like my letters, go crazy ğŸ‘½

Prashanthi

item.title: 5 Pnotions
item.description: I have no idea what to write here ğŸ¤·ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸
item.content:encoded:
I have no idea what to write here ğŸ¤·ğŸ»â€â™€ï¸

Hello everyone,

Welcome to Pnotions. It is a blog and a newsletter to share the interesting articles I read on technology and engineering. And more. It was tough to shortlist, but I did it.

Happy reading ğŸ‘¾

Technologyâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Imagen - Pytorch

Implementation of Imagen, Google's Text-to-Image Neural Network, in Pytorch.

ğŸ‘¾ Broadcom is acquiring VMware for $61 billion

Broadcom is known for its chip business, designing and manufacturing semiconductors for modems, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth chips across multiple devices. VMware, which was owned by Dell until it was spun off last year, focuses on cloud computing and virtualization technology.

ğŸ‘¾ Copilot, GitHubâ€™s AI-powered coding tool, will be free for students

Copilot is powered by an AI model called Codex thatâ€™s trained on billions of lines of public code to suggest additional lines of code and functions given the context of existing code.

ğŸ‘¾ Introducing Microsoft Dev Box

It is a cloud solution that provides developers with self-service access to high-performance workstations preconfigured and ready-to-code for specific projects.

ğŸ‘¾ Microsoft sounds the alarm on â€“ wait for it â€“ a Linux botnet

Microsoft has sounded the alarm on DDoS malware called XorDdos that targets Linux endpoints and servers.

ğŸ‘¾ GitHub saved plaintext passwords of npm users in log files, post mortem reveals

GitHub has revealed it stored a "number of plaintext user credentials for the npm registry" in internal logs following the integration of the JavaScript package registry into GitHub's logging systems.

Engineeringâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Envoy Gateway

Envoy Gateway is an open source project for managing Envoy Proxy as a standalone or Kubernetes-based application gateway.

ğŸ‘¾ How we deploy to production over 100 times a day

Less friction encourages smaller changes, and smaller changes are less risky.

ğŸ‘¾ Kubernetes 1.24: Introducing Non-Graceful Node Shutdown Alpha

This feature allows stateful workloads to failover to a different node after the original node is shutdown or in a non-recoverable state such as hardware failure or broken OS.

ğŸ‘¾ Stackrox

The StackRox Kubernetes Security Platform performs a risk analysis of the container environment, delivers visibility and runtime alerts, and provides recommendations to proactively improve security by hardening the environment.

ğŸ‘¾ How Airbnb Built â€œWallâ€ to prevent data bugs

Airbnb has embarked on a project of massive scale to ensure trustworthy data across the company.

Interesting readsâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Proton Is Trying to Become Googleâ€”Without Your Data

ğŸ‘¾ DuckDuckGo caught giving Microsoft permission for trackers

ğŸ‘¾ Weinberg's explaination for DuckDuckGo

ğŸ‘¾ The Day I Became Friends with a Robot

Crazy star of the weekâ€‹

ğŸŒ  Quine Relay

This is a Ruby program that generates Rust program that generates Scala program that generates ...(through 128 languages in total)... REXX program that generates the original Ruby code again.

Funâ€‹

If you like my letters, go crazy ğŸ‘½

Prashanthi

item.content:encoded:
Slow week madness ğŸ¦¥

Hello everyone,

Welcome to Pnotions. It is a blog and a newsletter to share the interesting articles I read on technology and engineering. And more. It was tough to shortlist, but I did it.

Happy reading ğŸ‘¾

Technologyâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Only DevSecOps can save the metaverse

From a DevOps point of view, securing the metaverse depends on integrating security as a fundamental process.

ğŸ‘¾ Lonestar plans to put datacenters in the Moon's lava tubes

How? Founder tells The Register 'Robotsâ€¦ lots of robots'

ğŸ‘¾ Introducing Google Cloudâ€™s new Assured Open Source Software service

Assured OSS enables enterprise and public sector users of open source software to easily incorporate the same OSS packages that Google uses into their own developer workflows.

ğŸ‘¾ Indian launch startup Skyroot successfully completes full-duration stage test

A full-duration test of the rocketâ€™s third stage.

ğŸ‘¾ India says VPN firms unwilling to comply with new rules â€˜will have to pull outâ€™

India is pushing ahead with its new cybersecurity rules.

ğŸ‘¾ WhatsApp ramps up revenue with global launch of Cloud API and soon, a paid tier for its Business App

WhatsApp is continuing its push into the business market with todayâ€™s news itâ€™s launching the WhatsApp Cloud API to all businesses worldwide.

Engineeringâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Better Load Balancing: Real-Time Dynamic Subsetting

Uberâ€™s current service mesh architecture that has been powering thousands of critical microservices in Uber since 2016.

ğŸ‘¾ Majority of Kubernetes API Servers Exposed to the Public Internet

Shadowserver Foundation researchers find 380,000 open Kubernetes API servers.

ğŸ‘¾ Grype

A vulnerability scanner for container images and filesystems.

ğŸ‘¾ OAuth Security in a Cloud Native World

OAuth family of specifications which provides modern security capabilities for web apps, mobile apps and APIs.

ğŸ‘¾ fd

A simple, fast and user-friendly alternative to 'find'.

Interesting readsâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Kubernetes is so easy

ğŸ‘¾ Appleâ€™s hidden setting instantly makes your video and audio calls sound better

ğŸ‘¾ Shady URL

ğŸ‘¾ Apple shipped me a 79-pound iPhone repair kit to fix a 1.1-ounce battery

Crazy star of the weekâ€‹

ğŸŒ  DALL-E-2

DALLÂ·E 2 is a new AI system that can create realistic images and art from a description in natural language.

Funâ€‹

If you like my letters, go crazy ğŸ‘½

item.title: 3 Pnotions
item.content:encoded:
Crazy tech week ğŸ§

Hello everyone,

Welcome to Pnotions. It is a blog and a newsletter to share the interesting articles I read on technology and engineering. And more. It was tough to shortlist, but I did it.

Happy reading ğŸ‘¾

Technologyâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Googleâ€™s biggest announcements at I/O 2022

Here are the biggest announcements we saw on Wednesday.

ğŸ‘¾ USTâ€™s Do Kwon Was Behind Earlier Failed Stablecoin, Ex-Terra Colleagues Say

Do Kwon, the CEO of Terra creator Terraform Labs, was one of the pseudonymous co-founders behind the failed algorithmic stablecoin Basis Cash, CoinDesk has learned.

ğŸ‘¾ The crypto crash, in 10 charts

On Twitter, users tell the story of Luna, Bitcoin, and Ethereumâ€™s downfall in data visualizations.

ğŸ‘¾ If you've got Intel inside, you probably need to get these security patches inside, too

Intel has disclosed high-severity bugs in its firmware that's used in datacenter servers, workstations, mobile devices, storage products, and other gear.

ğŸ‘¾ The iPod is dead

The end of the road.

ğŸ‘¾ Twitter Drama continues

Twitter deal is temporarily on hold.

Engineeringâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ How a ham and cheese sandwich got its own algorithm

A story of an airline and AWS

ğŸ‘¾ How to Monitor Endpoints in Kubernetes using Blackbox Exporter

Monitoring endpoints is an important aspect of system observability for diagnosing performance and availability issues.

ğŸ‘¾ Azure/aztfy

A tool to bring your existing Azure resources under the management of Terraform.

ğŸ‘¾ 7 trends to watch in the API economy

Here are the biggest trends shaping the future of the API economy. 

ğŸ‘¾ Squash and Rebase â€” My Method for Merging Git Branches

I find Git to be somewhat like coffee. Once Iâ€™ve found a method that works for me - I stick to it.

Interesting readsâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ An Ode to Apple's Hide My Email

ğŸ‘¾ 'I hate everybody including you'

ğŸ‘¾ Tech bubbles are bursting all over the place

ğŸ‘¾ Lego built a $170 Transformers Optimus Prime that actually transforms

Crazy star (Blackhole) of the weekâ€‹

Well, itâ€™s a Black Holeâ€‹

ğŸŒ  Astronomers Reveal First Image of the Black Hole at the Heart of Our Galaxy

Funâ€‹

Itâ€™s a conversation between the Brain and Heart

item.title: 2 Pnotions
item.content:encoded:
Oh yeah ğŸ’ƒğŸ»

Hello everyone,

Welcome to Pnotions. It is a blog and a newsletter to share the interesting articles I read on technology and engineering. And more. It was tough to shortlist, but I did it.

Happy reading ğŸ‘¾

Technologyâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Bored Ape Yacht Club creatorâ€™s metaverse mint rocks the Ethereum blockchain

Yuga Labs, the web3 company behind the Bored Ape Yacht Club, disrupted the entire Ethereum blockchain as a flood of users rushed to purchase NFTs representing virtual plots of land in its upcoming metaverse project, Otherside.

ğŸ‘¾ Apple Mail Now Blocks Email Tracking. Hereâ€™s What It Means for You

If you donâ€™t like marketers (or anyone else) knowing when and where you read your email, Appleâ€™s feature will help you reclaim some privacy.

ğŸ‘¾ Heroku resets user passwords after concluding April cyber-attack ran deep

Heroku, the Salesforce-owned cloud application platform, began the forced reset of user passwords on May 4.

ğŸ‘¾ Twitterâ€™s decentralized, open-source offshoot just released its first code

Bluesky, Twitterâ€™s open-source offshoot, has released early code for a decentralized social network protocol.

ğŸ‘¾ What Is Web3? The Confusing Term, Explained

The more complicated but more specific way to think about Web3 is an internet owned by users.

Engineeringâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ An unlikely database migration

â€œSo, what database do you use?â€

ğŸ‘¾ Dockerfiles now Support Multiple Build Contexts

This means you can use files from different local directories as part of your build.

ğŸ‘¾ The differences between Docker, containerd, CRI-O and runc

The main standards around containers that you should be aware of.

ğŸ‘¾ Virtual Kubernetes clusters: A new model for multitenancy

A virtual cluster is a shared Kubernetes cluster that appears to the tenant as a dedicated cluster.

ğŸ‘¾ Pulumi YAML: A Simple Declarative Interface for Pulumi

It is a simple YAML-based interface to the entirety of the Pulumi Infrastructure as Code platform.

ğŸ‘¾ Compromising Read-Only Containers with Fileless Malware

By making the file system unable to be altered, it prevents an attacker from writing their malware executable to disk.

Interesting readsâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Warren Buffett gives his most expansive explanation for why he doesnâ€™t believe in bitcoin

ğŸ‘¾ Top 5 Worst Programming Languages

ğŸ‘¾ IBM's asshole test

ğŸ‘¾ Google Docs crashed when fed 'And. And. And. And. And.'

Crazy star of the weekâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Totally fungible Ape

Funâ€‹

This weekâ€™s comic - Dilbert (main character, an engineer), Pointy-haired boss (The oblivious manager)

Until next time,

Prashanthi

Newsletter #2 Pnotions

item.title: 1 Pnotions
item.description: The first letter is shipped ğŸ›¸
item.content:encoded:
The first letter is shipped ğŸ›¸

Hello everyone,

Welcome to Pnotions. It is a blog and a newsletter to share the interesting articles I read on technology and engineering. And more. It was tough to shortlist, but I did it.

Happy reading ğŸ‘¾

Technologyâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Cloudflare blocks 15M rps HTTPS DDoS attack

Earlier this month, Cloudflareâ€™s systems automatically detected and mitigated a 15.3 million request-per-second (rps) DDoS attack â€” one of the largest HTTPS DDoS attacks on record.

ğŸ‘¾ Log4j Attack Surface Remains Massive

Four months after the Log4Shell vulnerability was disclosed, most affected open source components remain unpatched, and companies continue to use vulnerable versions of the logging tool.

ğŸ‘¾ India reveals plan to become major RISC-V design and production player by 2023

India's government has announced a plan and roadmap for local semiconductor design and production, based on the open source RISC-V architecture, and set a goal of delivering world-class silicon by the end of next year.

ğŸ‘¾ Telegram now lets users send cryptocurrency through TON blockchain spinoff

Telegram now lets users send Toncoin, the cryptocurrency built off of Telegramâ€™s abandoned blockchain effort, directly from chats within the messaging app.

ğŸ‘¾ And, yeah, Elon Musk bought Twitter.

Engineeringâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Progressive Delivery with Argo Rollouts : Blue-Green Deployment

Progressive delivery was introduced which enables the delivery of software with the right changes to the right amount of customers at the right time.

ğŸ‘¾ Kubectl detector for docker socket

A Kubectl plugin that can detect if any of your workloads or manifest files are mounting the docker.sock volume.

ğŸ‘¾ Spotify Live: From Live to Recording

Spotify Live (formerly Spotify Greenroom) is a platform that democratizes live audio streams. Creators are able to create rooms and stream live directly to fans who join the room.

ğŸ‘¾ Automatically Detect Operational Issues in Lambda Functions with Amazon DevOps Guru for Serverless

It allows developers to improve the operational performance and availability of serverless applications.

ğŸ‘¾ AWS CIDR finder - To quickly find unused CIDR blocks in your AWS VPC

ğŸ‘¾ Kubernetes 1.25 Release Team Shadow Application

If you are interested in contributing to Kubernetes, start the journey here.

Interesting readsâ€‹

ğŸ‘¾ Be careful with that thing, itâ€™s a confidential coffee maker - My favorite article of the week.

ğŸ‘¾ Is crypto just one big Ponzi scheme?

ğŸ‘¾ Please Don't Say Just Hello In Chat - Please donâ€™t.

ğŸ‘¾ My crazy DNS dream - I was working late on a DNS issue when I wrote this article. I wanted to share a fun version of my pain. I wrote this around 2:30 AM, published it, and went to sleep.

If you are wondering, yes, I solved the issue.

Funâ€‹

I love comics. Here is one of my favorites. Itâ€™s a conversation between the Brain and Heart.

Until next time,

Prashanthi

Newsletter #1 Pnotions

item.title: Welcome
item.content:encoded:
Beginning of the initial stageâ€‹

TL;DR
I am starting Pnotions, a blog, and a newsletter to share the interesting articles I read on Technology and Engineering. I will meet you every Sunday at 7 AM IST (starting May 1, 2022). If you like my letters, go crazy Pnotions ğŸ‘½

I have given a lot of thought to this section. What to do, what to share, etc. Then I realized that I was overthinking this. Yeah, I do that a lot. So, it is time to do something.

In the initial stage of Pnotions, I would like to share some of the articles from my reading list with everyone. I will share the posts here every Sunday morning, and you can also subscribe to my weekly newsletter.

This is my new tag #Pnotions. Every article I share from now on will have this tag.

And, my weekly newsletter, every Sunday morning ğŸ‰â€‹

Subscribe here Pnotions Newsletterâ€‹

The first newsletter, starting this Sunday (May 1, 2022)
